0.comment: Transparent - When a transparent alpha value is needed (without a background)

100.comment: Pin wash - Permanent overlay used on Pin images to ensure a visual separation between the white background and any Pin images that have pure white peripheries

200.comment: Overlay wash to be used sparingly. Only use it in situations where a high-level of opacity is needed and if the 40% doesn't fit the design goal

300.comment: Overlay wash to supply a mid-range wash over an item (e.g. #FFFFFF media controls | #000000 wash behind modals, wash on images with text overlays)

400.comment: Overlay wash used on most surface's scrims. Used to supply a low-level of opacity over an element (e.g. #FFFFFF image overlay | #00000 Board cover overlay)

500.comment: Component wash applied on IconButton and other elements as needed (e.g. image overlays). In dark mode we recommend an inverse wash ($color-background-wash-light instead of $color-background-wash-dark)
